titleStmt.title: An abridgement or suruey of poperie conteining a compendious declaration of the grounds, doctrines, beginnings, proceedings, impieties, falsities, contradictions, absurdities, fooleries, and other manifold abuses of that religion, which the Pope and his complices doe now mainteine, and vvherewith they haue corrupted and deformed the true Christian faith, opposed vnto Matthew Kellisons Suruey of the new religion, as he calleth it, and all his malicious inuectiues and lies, by Matthevv Sutcliffe.
titleStmt.author: Sutcliffe, Matthew, 1550?-1629.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Melchisedech Bradwood for Cuthbert Burbie,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The abridgement or suruey of popery.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
